response.overview: The Fixx wrote and recorded melodic, concise New Wave Rock, led by the powerful and emotive vocals of Cy Curnin, with the strong guitar work of Jamie West-Oram and keyboards of Rupert Greenall offering contrasting musical depth and texture.The band was a mainstay of the early days of MTV, with the videos for hits such as Red Skies and Stand Or Fall receiving heavy rotation airplay. This, and their willingness to tour the USA, ensured that they became one of the most successful British acts in the States in the mid-1980s, and - unlike many of their 1980s contemporaries - their music has stood the test of time extremely well.Their commercial peak came with the album Reach The Beach (1983) and their follow-up, Phantoms, was the album being promoted when they recorded this live session on 22nd February,1985.
response.title: The Fixx – Live at Rockpalast 1985
